summary: A Federal Bureau of Prisons psychologist's report detailing the response to a 'Body Alarm' for inmate Jeffrey Epstein on the morning of August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. The report describes staff finding Epstein in his cell and initiating emergency medical procedures, including retrieving a stretcher and an AED, before transporting him to Medical.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was the subject of the 'Body Alarm' and emergency medical response in his cell on 9 South.

persons.name: Lt Operations Lt.
persons.context: The intended recipient of the psychologist's incident report regarding the emergency involving inmate Epstein.

events.title: Body Alarm and Medical Emergency for Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: A 'Body Alarm' was activated on 9 South at approximately 6:35 AM. Staff, including medical personnel and the reporting psychologist, responded to inmate Jeffrey Epstein's cell. He was found unresponsive, and emergency procedures were initiated, including retrieving a stretcher and an AED, before he was transported to Medical.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The incident occurred on August 10, 2019, at approximately 6:35 AM.
Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell on the 9 South unit of the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
Emergency medical response was initiated, including the use of a stretcher and an Automated External Defibrillator (AED).
Epstein was transported from his cell to the Medical unit within the facility.
The document is a contemporaneous internal report from a Bureau of Prisons psychologist detailing the initial response to the incident.
